title: Water From Your Eyes’ Nate Amos Announces 2025 This Is Lorelei Tour
description: Youbet and Starcleaner Reunion will join for select dates of the North American tour
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: Youbet and Starcleaner Reunion will join for select dates of the North American tour

html:
Youbet and Starcleaner Reunion will join for select dates of the North American tour

This Is Lorelei, the solo project of Water From Your Eyes’ Nate Amos, is going on tour next year. The 2025 run will begin in Philadelphia on January 12 and brings Amos to over a dozen major cities in North America on through the spring, with Youbet and Starcleaner Reunion slated to join. The last This Is Lorelei show is currently scheduled for April 29 in Brooklyn, where he will open for MJ Lenderman. Check out the full list of tour dates below.

Amos released his first proper album under the This Is Lorelei moniker, Box for Buddy, Box for Star, earlier this summer. That full-length includes the breakout single “Dancing in the Club” and follows 2023’s EP #33. As for Water From Your Eyes, their most recent album, Everyone’s Crushed, came out last year. They also just remixed Clothing’s “Everything Is Free” for the duo’s Beauty Filter EP—out December 8. Listen to the new remix below.

Read about Box for Buddy, Box for Star in “The Best Music of 2024 So Far” and revisit Pitchfork’s rising interview “Alt-Pop Duo Water From Your Eyes Commit to the Bit.”

This Is Lorelei:

01-12 Philadelphia, PA - Johnny Brenda’s
01-13 Washington, D.C. - DC9 Nightclub *
01-14 Pittsburgh, PA - Bottlerocket Social Hall *
01-15 Lakewood, OH - Mahall’s *
01-17 Chicago, IL - Tomorrow Never Knows (Schubas) *
01-18 Detroit, MI - Lager House *
01-19 Toronto, Ontario - The Baby G *
01-21 Somerville, MA - The Rockwell *
01-22 Brooklyn, NY - Baby’s All Right *
03-23 San Diego, CA - The Casbah ^
03-24 Phoenix, AZ - The Rebel Lounge ^
03-26 Denver, CO - Globe Hall ^
03-27 Salt Lake City, UT - Kilby Court ^
03-31 Seattle, WA - Barboza ^
04-01 Portland, OR - Polaris Hall ^
04-03 San Francisco, CA - Cafe du Nord ^
04-04 Los Angeles, CA - Scribble ^
04-29 Brooklyn, NY - Brooklyn Steel %

* with Youbet
^ with Starcleaner Reunion
% with MJ Lenderman

Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. Previously, she was the music editor of the alt-weekly newspaper DigBoston, and she has contributed to Rolling Stone, Esquire, NPR, Vulture, Wired, Stereogum, and The A.V. Club. She’s based in Chicago.
